title: Standard form of a circle
text: The standard form of a circle is $$\left(x-h\right)^2+\left(y-k\right)^2=r^2$$.

title: Center
text: The center of an equation of a circle in standard form is (h,k). We can rewrite the equation as $$\left(x-1.5\right)^2+\left(y-\left(-2.5\right)\right)^2={0.5}^2$$. From here we get the center is $$(1.5, -2.5)$$.

title: Radius
text: The radius of an equation of a circle in standard form is simply the $$r$$ value. Note that in the standard form of the circle, $$r$$ is squared. We can rewrite the equation as $$\left(x-1.5\right)^2+\left(y-\left(-2.5\right)\right)^2={0.5}^2$$. From here we get the radius is $$0.5$$.
